gov.usgs.traveltime

Class ModDataVol

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.traveltime.ModDataVol

  • public class ModDataVol
extends java.lang.Object
    Store Earth model data for one wave type. Note that the model is normalized and the depths have undergone a flat Earth transformation. Also, only the upper 800 kilometers of the Earth model are available here. The reference version contains only information that is invariant.
    Author:
    Ray Buland

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ModDataVol(ModDataRef ref, ModConvert cvt)
      Load data from the FORTRAN file reader for the Earth model for one wave type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModDataVol

        public ModDataVol(ModDataRef ref,
                  ModConvert cvt)
        Load data from the FORTRAN file reader for the Earth model for one wave type. The file data should have already been loaded from the *.hed and *.tbl files.
        Parameters:
        ref - Model reference data source
        cvt - The Earth model units converter

    • Method Detail

      • findP

        public double findP(double z)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Find the model slowness for a desired depth.
        Parameters:
        z - Desired normalized, flattened depth
        Returns:
        Normalized slowness at the desired depth
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the desired depth is too deep

      • findZ

        public double findZ(double p,
                    boolean first)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Find the model depth for a desired slowness.
        Parameters:
        p - Desired normalized model slowness
        first - If true, find the top of a low velocity zone, if false, find the bottom
        Returns:
        Normalized depth at the desired slowness
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the desired slowness is too small

      • findMaxP

        public double findMaxP()
        Find the maximum slowness between the surface and the source. If the source is in a low velocity zone, this will be the slowness at the top. Otherwise, it will be the source slowness. Note that the parameters determined by the last call to findP is assumed.
        Returns:
        The normalized maximum slowness above the source

      • getOnGrid

        public boolean getOnGrid()
        Getter for the on a model grid point boolean.
        Returns:
        True if the source is exactly on a model grid point.

      • printFind

        public void printFind(boolean nice)
        Print the result of the latest findP or findZ call.
        Parameters:
        nice - If true, convert the model to SI units
